page.title: 16ST. JOSEPH'S SCHOOL.
page.content: St. Joseph's Roman Catholic School Sully Road, was built as a replacement school in 1970. The new school was officially opened on May 18th. 1970. It was planned for a total of 270 children, but this figure was soon passed and in a very short time the numbers reached 320. Today there are 230 pupils on roll, with Mr. Lane as Headteacher and nine class teachers. The original St. Joseph's was built in the town centre as a combined school and church in 1878 and was consecrated to St. Joseph by Bishop Hedley. By 1881 there were 68 pupils and Miss Hart was the only certificated teacher. As numbers increased, other buildings in the town were used as classrooms. There was a class in the Church Hall and two infant classes in Bute Lane School.
